attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: To arm all police officers with handguns
attributes.background: I believe all police officers should be armed with handguns for officers protection. Over the last 2 years terror attacks have become increasingly regular and some could have been stopped with a simple shot from an officer. It will add security to the job of law enforcement and act as a deterrent
attributes.additional_details: In America it has been seen that police can be attacked and that a handgun can prevent that. It can also bring an end to criminal situations much faster.

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Make Legal Provision for Northwest Regions of the UK to hold a Legal Referendum.
attributes.background: The referendum will give all citizens in the North a chance to vote on uniting UK Northern Regions to form an autonomous independent country breaking away from the South & the UK Government with Manchester as a Northern Capital with an elected Minister best placed to serve the citizens of N/England.
attributes.additional_details: Northern citizens suffer from lower life expectancy, lack of investment in areas such as education, health, skilled training and quality employment opportunities. Lack of political influence in London/South effects the Norths capability for economic growth. The neglect in these  areas is at such an extent that the North & South could be viewed as separate countries already. (One Example) IPPR thinktank, DT infrastructure spending 2016/17 London £1,943 per person, Northwest Region £680pp.

attributes.action: Make all companies share their maternity and paternity leave policies publically
attributes.background: Many companies provide maternity leave pay above the statutory minimum and increasing numbers also offer enhanced paternity pay. These can be invaluable for employees thinking about starting or growing their family but it's often a benefit you can't find out about when you sign up for a new job.
attributes.additional_details:
Making these policies publically available would help working parents make an informed choice about which companies they want to work for and help to celebrate the companies which are the most family friendly. It would also start to bring some parity to an area of benefits which at the moment varys widely from a couple of weeks full pay to a whole year. 

Having a child is one of life's most expensive adventures and choosing an employer who supports this shouldn't be left to chance or hearsay.

attributes.action: The UK to urge the UN to add Catalonia as a non-self-governing territory.
attributes.background: The UN charter defines a Non-Self-Governing Territory (NSGT) as one “whose people have not yet attained a full measure of self-government”. Given the recent actions of the Spanish regime, as permanent member of the UNSC the UK should urge that Catalonia be added to the NSGT list maintained by the UN
attributes.additional_details: Catalonia has a unique language, culture and ethnicity. Between 1930 and 1970 Spain as a state committed various violent repressions on the Catalonians and restricted their culture, language and identity. The Spanish terrorists who did this were formally pardoned by Madrid. Currently the Catalonians are expressing their right to self-determination through a peaceful referendum, which has been violently banned by the Spanish regime.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Scrap the OISC and extend the remit of the SRA to Immigration Advisers
attributes.background: The Office of Immigration Services Commissioner (OISC) is sponsored by the Home Office and regulates immigration advisers, professionals that do an important job and many are more specialised than solicitors. I believe the OISC operates in a secretive, undemocratic, biased and unfair manner.
attributes.additional_details:
It's powers are hardly challenged as it has many powers.

The fact this body quietly operates with professionals that do not have much legal knowledge can leave professionals open to unfair treatment. Surprisingly they almost always win cases in court. This cannot be right. The Home Office itself with much more infrastructure does not have this level of precision.

attributes.action: Ban the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while still alive and conscious.
attributes.background:
The Swiss government is banning the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while they are still conscious.

This is in response to studies that suggest lobsters have advanced nervous systems and feel pain.

Lobsters can live for up to 50 years and the practice of boiling them alive is barbaric.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pain_in_crustaceans

"Opinion on the aspects of the biology and welfare of animals used for experimental and other scientific purposes". The EFSA Journal. European Food Safety Authority. 292: 1–46. 2005.

https://onekindplanet.org/uploads/publications/cephalopods-decapod-crustaceans.pdf

attributes.action: Ban knives longer than 4 inches.
attributes.background:
No person needs a knife longer than 4 inches. If this law is passed then the UK will have a reduction in crime. 
Please sign the petition to make the UK a safer place.

attributes.action: Ban serving MPs holding paid directorships and significant 'outside interests'
attributes.background: MPs are our representatives, who, at present are paid an adequate £74,962 in line with inflation; with expenses to carry out their role. Yet, in 2015 some 180 MPs had second jobs, earning a total of £7.4m a year. Of these 112 were Conservative MPs and 43 were Labour.
attributes.additional_details: This is wrong. MPs are elected solely to represent the people and should, therefore, dedicate their full attention to fulfilling this duty, without the need for additional employment.

attributes.action: Impose an immediate ban on the use of Polystyrene in packaging.
attributes.background: Polystyrene is easily replaced with biodegradable alternatives. Polystyrene cannot be easily recycled and usually ends up in either landfill sites or the sea. Polystyrene breaks down easily to ever smaller partials which poison the food chain, and takes thousands of years to break down.

attributes.action: A fine to those who fail to intervene on a bully.
attributes.background: I am a parent to two happy teenagers and a pre-school educator to lovely pre-school children. I would hate it if anything bad happened to them. I would really love it if bullying was something of the past. I would like to help those who are vulnerable out there.
attributes.additional_details: I have seen many social media videos with children/teenagers being punched/kicked by bullies, and people passing by and not getting involved or stopping them. I would like people to intervene and help those who need help until parents or help arrives. Those who ignore it should be fined. It’s not only our (teacher's) duty to help vulnerable children out there. It should be everyone's out there (mum, dad, grandma/dad, aunties and uncles). Everyone should help.

attributes.action: Ensure electric kick scooters are legal in cycle lanes
attributes.background: Government should clarify whether or not current law allows electric kick scooters in cycle lanes. If it doesn’t, it should change the law so that they are. These scooters are great way to get about and a good way to reduce pollution and numbers of bicycles locked to every free space possible.
attributes.additional_details:
- In emergency situations the user can get off/dismount the PELV at any time compared to electric bikes.
 
- They only use 250 watts which is exactly the same as an electric bike and travel at 8-12 mph.
 
- You are more likely to have an accident on a bicycle than on a scooter which you can get off at any point when ridden sensibly.
 
- The Government should consider the reduction of pollution.

attributes.action: Restrict how soon shops, supermarkets can put out for sale Easter products.
attributes.background: This is destroying the spirit of Christmas and Easter as they are becoming one event. There should be a restriction that prevents shops from doing this, eg a time restriction of for example 8 weeks before Easter.
attributes.additional_details: Walking around my local Tesco supermarket on the 4th January I was confronted with Easter chocolates for sale (and we're talking proper Easter eggs, not just small cream eggs) I also understand some retailers had Easter out on New Years day. This is wrong and erodes the meaning of these events as they are becoming like the sales, an event that happens every day. It is not good for children to see things available so quickly as this does not teach them anything about the significance of the day.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax allowance discrepancy between UK worker & Tier2  employee
attributes.background:
A UK worker receives no taxfree allowance for paying utility bills, rent or council tax. Also, pays compulsory NI. 
A seconded worker under Tier2 Inter-Company Transfer scheme gets tax free allowance for paying utility bills, rents & council tax under Dispensation model plus optional NI for 2 years
attributes.additional_details:
ICT worker with £40,000 annual salary receives 20-40% of salary (£700-£1200 per month) as tax free allowance. 
E.g. Gross Pay=£40,000
Annual Income tax paid by ICT worker is £2,818.20
UK worker pays £9,518.52 
A normal UK worker pays 3 times the tax paid by a person on Tier2 seconded employee. Can government explain the reason behind this discrimination between UK & Non-UK employed person?  
Can government and HMRC explain what are the benefits of this system to the Great Britain & wider public?

attributes.action: Offset any rise in the price of fuel
attributes.background: As Christmas is approaching, I would like to propose that if the price of a litre of fuel is to rise by 3p then the government should reduce the amount of tax on fuel by the very same amount. As a result, motorists will not be impacted by any fuel cost rises.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public transport (buses) to be fitted with seatbelts.
attributes.background: In light of the two elderly ladies who were recently injured on a public transport bus.

attributes.action: Pay reparations to Caribbean descendants of slavery.
attributes.background: The British government owes Caribbean people reparations for the horrors carried out on black people during slavery. The sugar cane plantations helped to fund many cooperations still in existence today, these families cam be traced and great Britain should be held accountable for its atrocities.

attributes.action: Create a devolved parliament for the county of Devon
attributes.background: Devon has for too long been put at the bottom of the agenda by the out-of-touch Government in Westminster. We have received far too little in the way of funding for education and the NHS. A devolved assembly would allow us to decide on issues like tax, agriculture housing and education.
attributes.additional_details: The Government at Westminster has for too long now shown a complete lack of regard for The South West and Devon in particular. And despite promises, our hospitals, schools and infrastructure has been underfunded and it is making the people of Devon frustrated. Our pupils are underfunded, local hospitals are being forced to close and our railway system is dreadful, with projects planned before WWII that still haven't been completed. We want a more prosperous Devon inside a fairer united Kingdom.

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ban cyclists to ride on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: To cycle is a good activity to keep you fit and to impact less on the environment. The problem arises when a cyclist decides to take a ride on a dual carriageway: with motorised vehicles going as fast as 70mph the likelihood of an accident are high, especially at night.

attributes.action: Make it law that all shops have adequate cctv coverage.
attributes.background:
I had my phone stolen in a store in Westfield & this store did not have cctv. 
If cctv had been available, security could have checked to see if the offender was still in the area.
I'm sure I'm not the only person to experience this, nor the frustration that follows.

attributes.action: Make rent to own companies illegal
attributes.background: Some companies’ lending practices are targeting the "poorest, most desperate families" and operating in the "most deprived areas" of the UK. The customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. This is making people already in debt further in debt.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that they are targeting the UK's most vulnerable (poorest and most desperate families), and operating in the most deprived areas. Customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. Some base prices have also been noted to be higher than those of upscale mainstream retailers such as Harrods. This is totally unacceptable, with the interest rates in need of review.

attributes.action: Require all car manufactures to offer retrofitting of L.E.D DRL
attributes.background:
I acknowledge that it is now a legal requirement for new cars to be fitted with DRL, however older vehicles can be retrofitted with them as they have a lot of benefits.
The point of the petition is to make it a legal requirement for all car manufactures to offer retrofitting LED DRL's
attributes.additional_details:
In the research conducted by the European Commision in 2006 it has been confirmed that they have potential in reducing road deaths due to making the vehicle more visible to other road users during the day and are then switched off when sidelights/dipped lights are switched on. 

Third party retrofitting systems are available but are not very reliable, hence why I wish all car manufactures to offer LED DRL's that would be installed by the manufacturer themselves.

attributes.action: Make the UK higher education system work like the US education system
attributes.background: In the first two years of study, in the American higher education system, you will generally be required to take a wide variety of classes in different subjects. I feel this is better than picking what you want to study ahead of going to university because you get a more rounded education.
attributes.additional_details:
One criticism of the American system is that teaching is more superficial than in UK higher education. I would argue, however, that students will gain a more rounded education this way. 

My reference for the way the HE system works in America is: https://www.studyusa.com/en/a/58/understanding-the-american-education-system

My reference for the American system being more superficial is: https://www.theguardian.com/higher-education-network/blog/2014/jun/30/uk-universities-better-education-dont-be-seduced-by-us

attributes.action: Ban any future police usage of brainwave scanners (electroencephalograms).
attributes.background: EEG's read brainwaves and can compute, so far, very simple thoughts - with around 60 - 90% accuracy. Introduction of these, upon further development, voids the point of the majority of the police force and is a gross breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: In a world becoming more and more technological, there is only one true privacy left - the brain. Introduction of EEG's to the police force would bring Britain on a par with George Orwell's 1984, and would take away yet more power from the public - the people the Government are supposed to serve. EEG's should still be available to services such as the NHS, as with some development, people with locked in syndrome could communicate again. Apart from that, they should be illegal or banned.

attributes.action: Scrap or Re-evaluate Hazard Perception
attributes.background:
The 'hazard perception' part of UK theory tests is one of the most hated parts of becoming a learner driver. 
The hazard perception part is taken on a computer, where you click the screen when you see a developing hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
The problem with this part of the theory test is that you have to spot 'developing hazards', and if you spot a hazard 'too early' you do not get the marks. Put this into real life, spotting a hazard too early? The entire marking scheme is pathetic. 
I do not disagree with the idea however, as spotting hazards is essential for safe driving. The hazard perception should be incorporated in the practical test and marked by an examiner, someone able to think, and not a computer.

attributes.action: Law to be introduced so that members of the Emergency Services are served first.
attributes.background: Members of the Emergency Services work long and stressful hours. Often they will stop at a food establishment at the end of or during a shift. To be faced by a long queue when they just want to get home or get some refreshment. They may get a call-out while queuing so go without food or drink.
attributes.additional_details: A new law needs to be introduced. So that members of the Emergency Services in uniform always get served first at food establishments before other Customers.

attributes.action: To made possible to claim disability discrimination when applying for a school.
attributes.background: Currently, the law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against Local Authority when they fail to secure a place at chosen school. The decision is made by Local Authority and SEND Tribunal can only act aginst schools.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of wild caught species in the pet trade
attributes.background: Reptiles and fish are the most affected. 100s species of fish have gone extinct over the last 100 years because of the pet trade as they have been taken from their homes. It’s the same with reptiles, invertebrates and mammals.
attributes.additional_details: Imagine being a tortoise living in the desert and one day someone comes, puts you in a cage, ships you off to somewhere you don’t know and before you know it you are behind glass, ready to be sold to people -  many of whom don’t treat their pets right . Many animals die in the transportation from their homes to the pet shop . Fish are caught using cyanide, divers spray it on the coral reef to paralyse the fish then catch them and take them to be exported worldwide. This is wrong it needs to end.

attributes.action: Scrap English language (IELTs) test for spouse visa
attributes.background: UK has introduced English language test (Ielts), for the family members of British citizens without which its imposible to join them in the uk. I am personally affected by this as I have two kids under the age of 3 and I can’t bring them to the uk because their mum is unable to speak English.
attributes.additional_details: I hope this law is changed which will make it possible for thousands of families around the uk to be united with Their loved ones.I think it’s unfair for a war-torn country like Afghanistan which has been and is in war since 1978, how can the uk government expect such uneducated population to read and write their own language let alone speak English.

attributes.action: Create a new criminal offence. Use of a vehicle to threaten or intimidate.
attributes.background: More and more often people use their vehicle as a weapon toward other, more vulnerable road users. That could be a car driver toward a cyclist or pedestrian, or indeed a cyclist toward a pedestrian. The intentional close pass and other bullying is something that simply cannot be accepted on the road

attributes.action: Make the purchase and use of pepper spray and/or stun devices legal.
attributes.background: It is almost illegal to defend yourself in the UK. I think it is about time; especially considering current situation, that it changes. It should be legal to carry an item for the purpose of defence and the above items should be legalised, even if licensing is required.

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: Recognise a need for local and government financial support for carers under 18
attributes.background: There are about 700,000 young carers (under 18) in the UK. They provide everyday care and support to their parents and relatives that adults carers do. However, they are not entitled to a such support as adult carers are. It is time the government considers how best to support these children.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to decide if the public agree with the deal made with EU
attributes.background:
Hold a referendum for the public to decide whether we the people accept the deal made between the government and the EU for Britains exit from the union.

The referendum must only decide between:
leave with the deal that's presented.
or 
leave with no deal.
There must be no option to remain.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Ban import of all Burmese products to the UK
attributes.background:
Discriminatory government policies and militry violance in Mayanmar have compelled 600,000 Rohingya's to fled their homes to Bangladesh.

Violations of human rights, including burning villages, killings, raping, torturing women & children, ethnically cleansing Burma of Rohingya population.
attributes.additional_details:
Rohingya are Muslim minority group. They differ from Myanmar’s dominant Buddhist groups ethnically, linguistically, and religiously.

The government refuses to grant the Rohingya citizenship, as a result they have no legal documentation, effectively making them stateless. Myanmar’s 1948 citizenship law was already exclusionary, and the military junta, which seized power in 1962, introduced a law twenty years later stripping the Rohingya of access to full citizenship.

attributes.action: abolish the housing benefit cap to stop families with children living in poverty
attributes.background: over 400,000 will be living in poverty because of the housing benefits rules this must end to give those affected a chance of living a life without the worry about not having money to give there kids a better life

attributes.action: Make schools and colleges have longer or more breaks between working times.
attributes.background: Many schools do not have long enough breaks between work periods, I suggest the solution that schools and colleges get more time at breaks or have breaks at regular intervals. Such as expanding a 15 minute break to being 25 minutes to encourage socialising to make school an enjoyable environment.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killers
attributes.background: Codeine is a drug that is sold without prescription in the UK. It is used by drug addicted in order to “get high” in big dosage, which is equal to what’s contained in one pack (30 tablets). It is banned for opened sale in US, Germany, Japan and Australia.

attributes.action: Make sure we get a Brexit Deal.
attributes.background: If Brexit didn't have a deal, it would be chaos for us. If we can't get a  deal, we're on our own, and we'll have to rely on other countries to give us power and maybe being the end of the UK altogether. So there must be a Brexit deal, or we're in anarchy.

attributes.action: Change laws for British citizenship so they refer to ‘parent’ not ‘father’.
attributes.background:
The right to British citizenship depends on a number factors but sometimes, just the father.

An example is seen here: https://www.gov.uk/register-british-citizen/born-before-2006-british-father.

There is no need for gender at all.

attributes.action: Changing the legal age for vaping WITHOUT nicotine from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: By lowering the age from 18 to 16 will allow young people who smoke to turn to a safer alternative. This will lower the lung cancer rate in young people. Save lives and lower the vaping age.
